Package org.troyargonauts.common.drivers.vision

Class Limelight

java.lang.Object
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
org.troyargonauts.common.drivers.vision.Limelight
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
public class Limelight extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Limelight.CameraMode
    There are 2 states that the Limelight's Camera can be in: VISION - Turns on the Limelight's vision processing pipeline DRIVER - Turns on the Limelight's driver mode
    static enum 
    Limelight.LightMode
    There are 3 states that the Limelight's LEDs can be in: OFF - Turns off the Limelight's LEDs BLINK - Turns on the Limelight's LEDs and blinks them ON - Turns on the Limelight's LEDs

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Limelight getInstance()
      Gets the Limelight instance
      Returns:
      the Limelight instance

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Horizontal offset from crosshair to target (27 degrees to -27 degrees)
      • 0 degrees means that the target is centered in the crosshair
      • 27 degrees means that the target is all the way the right of the image.
      • -27 degrees means that the target is all the way to the left of the image.
      Returns:
      the horizontal offset of the target relative to the crosshair

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Vertixal offset from crosshair to target (20.5 degrees to -20.5 degrees)
      • 0 degrees means that the target is centered in the crosshair
      • 20.5 degrees means that the target is at the top of the image.
      • -20.5 degrees means that the target is at the bottom to the left of the image.
      Returns:
      the vertical offset of the target relative to the crosshair

    • getTa

      public double getTa()
      Area that the detected target takes up in total Camera iamge (0% to 100%).
      Returns:
      Area of target.

    • getTs

      public double getTs()
      Gets target skew or rotation (-90 degrees to 90 degrees). The skew is the angle of the target relative to the crosshair.
      Returns:
      Target skew.

    • getTl

      public double getTl()
      Gets target latency (ms).
      Returns:
      Target latency.
